page.title: 10Llynfi valley Forestry
page.content: Part of the{Afan forest}is situated on the slopes of{Garnwen mountain} and on the slopes of{Darren y Bannau}on the eastern side of the{Llynfi valley.}The {Afan forest}is a{coniferous forest. Men grew these forests and use its softwood for various commodities, for props to be used in the local {Colleries,}fences for farmers and {paper pulp}for{making paper.}In the Winter the needles of the larch tree fall off. But the{evergreen trees}stay green all the year round. The tree trunks are very tall and very thin because they race towards the sunlight. Each of these trees are six feet apart and about twenty metres high and the forest is about 50 years old. The animals you would find in the Afan forest are{deer, foxes, {squirrels, weasels, snakes, stoats, {rabbits}and{birds.
